data.name: 1D function root finder
data.description:
Build a function `find1DRoot` that finds the root of a one-dimensional mathematical function `f` between a pair of lower and upper bounds `[lower, upper]`.  The root of a function is an input value that produces an output value of `0`.

For example:

```javascript
var f = function(x) { return Math.pow(x, 2) - 9; };
find1DRoot(f, [2, 4])
```

should return a value close to `3`, since `f(3) = 0`.

`f` will be a continuous function with exactly one root between the lower and upper bounds provided.

The numerical difference between the root found by `find1DRoot` and the actual root should be at most 0.01% of the difference between the lower and upper bounds.
